We do offer rental cars though to experienced travellers who speak Spanish at own risk. It is a kind of adventure and depends very much on everyone’s abilities to deal with eventual challenges. Please plan a chat with us when you wish to receive more details. Cuba stays fascinating and an amazing destination. We also offer since recently again holidays and relatively short roundtrips in East Cuba with our teams in Havana & Baracoa, all traveling by private taxi. You can fly in and out from the Holguin international airport.

dayInfo.description: Reception at Havana airport and private taxi or minivan to your boutique homestay in historical Old Havana. Welcome dinner.

Guided walking tour of 5 hrs included through Old Havana in the morning, including boat tour over the Bay to El Christo and Che Guevara house. Optional private salsa classes. Great gourmet dinner locations arranged.

Travel to Vinales with private minivan or 16 seated bus depending of size group. You will be accompanied by an expert tour- and moutainleader and Cuban guide. The bus and driver will stay the whole travel with us giving us the greatest flexibility. Great homestays in Vinales with view on mogote mountains in quiet alley. Afternoon tour to a tobacco fermentation house and excursion to cave of Santo Tomas included.

Full day hike with a guide of the NP Vinales and your tourleader. Transfer to start trail to Los Acuaticos, visit last members of water community included and walk close along the vertical mogote walls with excellent views into the valley. From there descending again through the valley, visit tobacco farmers and via the Toro cave walk back to Vinales.

We start with some birdwatching of one hr at a special mogote valley where we have a special birdwatchers trail. After a cup of coffee we start from the same valley, we cross the mogote mountains via off the beaten trails into the Vinales valley, lunch in a tobacco cottage and end the day with a typical cocktail in rocking chairs above the Vinales valley. All transfers included. Alternatives for those who prefer not to walk, are having a beachday, enjoy horse back riding and-or renting a bike.

Today a full beach day at tropical island Cayo Jutias included, this is a tropical key connected by the road and visited mainly by Cuban day tourists and some travelers. Has good snorkeling and diving options, there is a small dive center here and you can go by speedboat to the coral reefs for an excursion, you can rent equipment here at the school and it has a restaurant with bar on the beach. Return to homestay Viñales.

Drive from Viñales to Soroa. Visit viewpoint, waterfall and orchid garden of Soroa. To visit the viewpoint you have to ascend a hill with tropical vegetation and in the end you have a spectacular view over the landscape. Stay in different homestays at Soroa with the main family an art family with beautiful garden and workshop.

Full day hiking excursion through the mountains and along streams. With a local bird guide and medicinal plants expert, share a coffee break with a coffee farmer and have lunch with a Cuban family who lives in the tropical forest of former coffee plantations.

Travel to Cienfuegos via the Bay of Pigs with a private minivan, stopping along the way for historical points, and a couple of hours for snorkelling or diving at Cueva de los Peces and to have lunch. Late afternoon arrival at homestays in historical heart of Cienfuegos.

In the morning included private guided excursion through colonial Cienfuegos and along the bay of Cienfuegos. In the afternoon included a boat trip and visit a fort at the other side of the Bay. This is with a private fisher boat. Stay overnight Cienfuegos.

Early departure to the Guanaroca lagoon for birdwatching and to see the flamingoes. Visit the botanical garden of Cienfuegos. From here continuation to Trinidad homestays with terraces and views in village Trinidad. Included a private guided cultural tour through the colonial center. Late afternoon free time to wander through Trinidad, have salsa classes and-or visit beach Ancon for snorkeling at coral reefs.

Leave the city today to head into the Sierra Escambray mountains. You’ll visit a coffee museum and hike to the gorgeous Hacienda Codina, a former Spanish coffee-growing ranch. There is time to swim along the way, and explore the Batata Cave. After lunch, you can take a botanical walk before rewarding yourself with a refreshing ginger cocktail at the hacienda. Stay overnight under a starry sky at hacieda Codina.

Small transfer by Russian truck or jeep, continuation hike to Hacienda Gallega in NP Guayanara, visit of coffee farmer along the way. In afternoon walk to waterfalls and optional descend along river from waterfall to a lagoon. Late afternoon return by minivan to Trinidad. All transfers, meals, with some drinks in this 2 day mountain program included.

Full day Catamaran group excursion to tropical island Cayo Leguano with snorkeling, beachlife, time for exploration island, its mangrove forest and shallow water marine flora and fauna, with paella fish lunch on the island. The island is habited by large populations of leguanos & some hutias (friendly tree rodents). All transfers included. Great gourmet dinner location at roof of homestay.

Travel with private minivan to Camaguey boutique homestay in historical center. Included visit open air museum in the Sugarmill valley, hacienda Iznaga or San Isidro. Late afternoon 3 hrs private guided tour by bike taxi through colonial Camaguey included.

Travel to Santiago homestays in historical center with private minivan. In afternoon included guided walking tour through Santiago of 3 hrs, visiting house of Velazquez and Fidel Castro, the cathedral, Casa de La Trova and the balcony of Velasquez. Great homestay dinner in patio in the middle of a green urban garden and orchids. Optional salsa classes.

Today full day Santiago excursion and surroundings with minivan included. Visit cemetery which is the resting place of Jose Marti & Fidel Castro, Moncado garrison which is a school now, Plaza de Revolucion and the beautifully located fortress El Morro with views over the Caribbean. After this go into the mountains to Gran Piedra of the Sierra Maestra which is already worth visiting the tour through the mountains and the views on top of the rock, from here we make a small walk to visit the oldest French coffee settlement near to the Gran Piedra. It is a hacienda museum beautifully located in nature (good for birdwatching as well) with very little tourism and gives some insight in this part of the Cuban history. At the end of the day we visit in the late afternoon a small museum dedicated to the start of the Revolution and go for a swim from a tropical beach in the Caribbean sea. Optional salsa classes.

Today to Baracoa, the pearl of the east, with private minivan and have several stops along the most beautiful roadtrip of Cuba included. One stop will be a beachstop of 1,5 hrs at the south coast road. and combined with the visit of the famous beach monument at the landing site of Jose Marti at Playita Cajobabo. Other photostops are at Guantanamo bay viewpoint and the highest view point in the mountains going to Baracoa. Baracoa boutique homestays in center village with terraces and views.

Day hike, with crossing the saddle of El Yunque in the morning with visit of a local school in the mountains, visit of a cocao plantation, farmer with a coffee stop. Have a lunch included at Rio Toa, with a boat ride to a coco key and walk over this small coco plantation, pick up by boat again and have a boat ride to the beach. From here we will have then a beachwalk from Rio Toa to Rio Duabe. All transfers included, with the best guide of Baracoa and most complete program. Baracoan typical lunch included at ecofriendly lodge.

If you’ve ever wondered where exactly chocolate comes from, all will be revealed today with a tour of a cacao plantation and chance to meet the families who turn the beans into chocolate. Have a small walk along a mangrove forest through coconut plantations. Stop at a beachside fishing settlement for lunch then row into the Yumuri Canyon for a small walk and swim in the canyon. Depending on the sea tides program is adapted.

Free day. Participants can inscribe on different waterfall and hiking programs, horseback riding, jeep safaris to El Faro, hike to the top of el Yunque or just go to beach Maguana. The daywalk Balcon of Iberia in the NP Humboldt can be combined with snorkeling at Baracoas best coral reef location hidden in a bay and with going to the famous beach Playa Maguano.

By private minivan return to Santiago. Photostops along the way and coffee break at Guantanamo. Early dinner can be arranged at homestay in Santiago. Originally domestic flight planned at 18 - 22 hrs to Havana, however all domestic flights are suspended on Cuba. So it will be with a nightbus back to Havana, dep around 8pm.

Arrival in morning around noon. Taxi transfer included to boutique homestay in Old Havana. In early afternoon you will have time to visit museums, stroll through Old Havana again, have salsa classes, go for some shopping at the souvenir market in the harbour. Farewell dinner at 7pm. For the late evening at 9 -10pm there exists the option to go to the Havana Queens or Tropicana dance show with the splendour of Cuban folkloric dances and vibrant salsa.
Transfer included by minivan for the departures of the main group, flights home. Extensions Havana and Varadero are optional same as continuations to other Latin destinations from Havana.

generalInfo:
Combining authentic cultural encounters with active explorations of the Cuban countryside, this Multisport Tour offers a fascinating insight into what makes this nation tick. Over eight days and seven nights, experience the pulsing beat of Havana and the history-drenched streets of Trinidad, as well as the remote beauty of Zapata National Park and the Sierra Escambray.? 
 
By bicycle, kayak and on foot, you’ll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in Cuba’s rich heritage and its multifaceted modern society while learning about the work being done to protect its natural environments. Along the way, you’ll be helping to enrich and strengthen civil society as part of the Support for the Cuban People program.

dayInfo.description: Make your way to Havana, with several commercial flights operating between Miami and the Cuban capital. We highly recommend that you arrive at least a day before the tour starts to accommodate for flight delays or cancellations and we can assist with booking additional nights’ accommodation if needed. Alternatively, you may opt to fly to Miami on Day 0 and spend the night there before an early morning connection to Havana. Your tour officially starts at 11 am on Day 1.

Havana Vieja - Welcome to Havana! After our orientation meeting at 11 am, it’s time to head out on foot and discover the fascinating architecture and lively atmosphere of the Cuban capital. For both lunch and dinner, we will dine at local paladar's, with these private restaurants serving authentic Cuban dishes. In the evening, you’ll have the opportunity to experience Havana’s legendary nightlife. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Lunch and Dinner

Playa Larga + Bay of Pigs + Zapata National Park - After an early morning start, we’ll drive southeast to Playa Larga, a peaceful village overlooking the Bay of Pigs. Our first destination is a crocodile nursery doing vital work to preserve Cuba’s native reptilians. Afterward, we’ll cycle (8.7 miles) to our kayak launch point for a leisurely paddle (1.5 to 2 hours). As you explore the Bay of Pigs, you’ll learn all about the lead up to the failed invasion of 1961. In the late afternoon, we’ll check into our casa particular and be treated to a presentation from the director of Zapata National Park, Frank Medina. Learn about the park’s past and the future goals he and his team have for preserving this magnificent area. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Playa Giron + Cienfuegos - Our day begins at the Museum of Playa Giron where we’ll delve a little further into the history of the Bay of Pigs Invasion. This will be followed by a snorkel above the healthy reefs that lie just offshore from Playa Giron, with our local guides sharing their knowledge of this thriving underwater ecosystem. After lunch, we’ll enjoy a scenic cycle (15 to 27 miles) to Yaguamayas before continuing by bus to Cienfuegos where we will check into our casa particular. Nicknamed the “Pearl of the South”, Cienfuegos is an enchanting seaside city with a distinctly French flair. In the late afternoon, we’ll stroll along its waterfront and visit the 19th-century Teatro Tomás Terry, renowned for its impressive mosaics and frescoes, before relaxing over dinner. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Guanaroca Nature Reserve + Cienfuegos Botanical Gardens + Trinidad - Today begins with a paddle (3 hours) across the waters of Laguna Guanaroca, a mangrove-fringed waterway and birder’s paradise. If we’re lucky, we might spot flamingos, pelicans, and Cuban’s national bird, the trogon. From Guanaroca, we’ll continue to the bay of Cienfuegos and enjoy lunch at a remote seaside restaurant near la Milpa. Afterward, we’ll jump onto our bikes for a scenic ride to the Cienfuegos Botanical Gardens, which is home to more than 2,000 different species. During a talk by one of the staff members, you’ll learn about the gardens’ creation by an American sugar baron and its role in the agricultural history of Cuba. From Cienfuegos, we will continue to one of Cuba’s oldest cities, Trinidad, where we will spend the night. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner

Topes de Collantes National Park + Río Guourabo - This morning we will travel into the pine-covered Sierra Escambray to explore Topes de Collantes National Park, beginning with a hike (3 to 4 miles) to the picturesque waterfalls of El Cubano. The park is renowned for its abundant birdlife, with a variety of native species inhabiting its tropical rainforest. After lunch in the mountains, we’ll descend to the coastline and launch our kayaks at La Boca for a leisurely paddle (2 hours) along the Río Guourabo. In addition to birdwatching and seeing the place where Hernan Cortez landed in the 16th century, you’ll be treated to elevated views across Trinidad. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner

Trinidad to Sancti Spiritus - This morning will be spent cycling from Trinidad to Sancti Spiritus (10 to 40 miles), another beautiful city that oozes colonial charm. Founded in 1514 by Diego Velázquez, it is one of the oldest of Cuba’s European settlements. After checking into your accommodation, you’ll have time to explore the city and walk across the arched Puente Yayabo, as well as admire Cuba’s oldest theatre, the Teatro Principal. Dinner will be enjoyed at one of the local restaurants. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner

Santa Clara + Havana - After breakfast, we will depart Sancti Spiritus and make our way to Santa Clara to visit the Che Guevara Mausoleum. Continuing west, we’ll stop again on the outskirts of Havana to explore Finca Vigia, otherwise known as the Ernest Hemingway Museum. It was here that the author spent many years of his life and penned several works. After our visit, we’ll continue into Havana and our accommodation for the night before reconvening for our farewell dinner at a local restaurant. Accommodations: Casa Particular (Bed & Breakfast) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Havana - With your tour at an end, it’s time to make your way back to Havana International Airport for your flight home or continue your travels in Cuba.

generalInfo:
Explore Cuba through the lens on this immersive eight-day tour from Havana. Document the urban buzz of the Cuban capital and the storied Bay of Pigs before photographing wildlife amidst the wetlands of Zapata National Park. Connect with a legendary photographer in the colonial streets of Trinidad and take an architectural tour of Cienfuegos, the “Pearl of the South”.

Along the way, you’ll have genuine encounters with everyday Cubans as you experience the local culture in unique and surprising ways. With a camera in hand, you’ll gain a better understanding of the island nation’s turbulent past and why it’s still one of the Caribbean’s most enchanting destinations today.

Please note: Travel to Cuba requires a flexible attitude and while we try our best to stick to the following itinerary, it may change due to the availability of local experts and weather conditions. Wherever possible, we will substitute these with similar activities that reflect our Support for the Cuban People initiatives. As our guests, we ask that you approach this tour with an open mind and support your guides in delivering what is sure to be a memorable adventure.

dayInfo.description: Travel to Cuba - Make your way to Havana, with several commercial flights operating from the United States with American Airlines. We highly recommend that you arrive at least a day before the tour starts to accommodate for flight delays or cancellations and we can assist with booking additional nights’ accommodation if needed. Alternatively, you may opt to fly to Miami on Day 0 and spend the night there before an early morning connection to Havana. Your tour officially starts at 11 am on Day 1 at Havana's Jose Marti International Airport where you will be met by your tour leader.

Havana - Fly into Havana where you will be met by your tour guide and transferred into the city center. The group will meet over lunch at a palatial mansion that has been transformed into a private restaurant known as a paladar. After lunch, we’ll spend time exploring the colonial streets of Havana Vieja, which was established by the Spanish in the 16th century. It’s home to beautifully preserved buildings that exhibit Neoclassical and Baroque architectural styles, as well as bustling plazas fringed by alfresco cafes. In the late afternoon, we’ll settle into our casa particular before heading out to dine at another paladar, La Guardia. It offers elevated views across the streets below from its top-floor location, which was used as a setting for the film “Strawberries and Chocolate”. After dinner, you may opt to return to your accommodation or experience Havana’s legendary nightlife. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Lunch, dinner

Bay of Pigs - Today, we leave the bustling streets of Havana and make the drive east towards Boca de Guama and the Criadero de Cocodrillos breeding center. Established in 1962, its staff work tirelessly to protect Cuban and American crocodiles from extinction while educating the public about the threats to their survival. In addition to seeing crocodiles of various ages up close, you can photograph their powerful jaws in action during a feeding session. After lunch at the Restaurante Boca de Guama, we’ll continue driving to Playa Larga and settle into our casa particular. In the mid-afternoon, we’ll explore the wide beaches of the Bay of Pigs while learning about the momentous events that took place here in 1961. You can swim in the bay before photographing the sunset over the Caribbean Sea. In the evening, we will meet the director of Zapata National Park, Frank Medina, to learn about the conservation and tourism challenges he and his team face. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch, dinner

Zapata National Park - This morning, we will travel to Las Salinas and explore the wetlands of Zapata National Park, which provides a habitat for Cuban trogons and bee hummingbirds. Flocks of pink flamingos can often be seen wading in the shallows, making for incredible photographs. With the help of a local guide, you’ll discover everything there is to know about the area’s mangrove forests. In the afternoon, you’ll be learning about the Korimacao Community Project, which offers training in everything from dancing and singing to playing musical instruments. It’s a great opportunity to capture portraits of everyday Cubans or even take to the dancefloor yourself. In the evening, we will dine on locally caught seafood at a local paladar before being treated to a musical performance by a local band. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch, dinner

Playa Giron - After an early start, we’ll head to Playa Giron to tour the Bay of Pigs Museum and learn about the area’s bloody past. Aside from hearing about the 17th-century French buccaneer who was killed on the nearby shores, you can browse the black and white photographs depicting the events that led up to the Cuban Revolution. Our next stop is an isolated beach where you will have the opportunity to go swimming and snorkeling on what is one of the best-preserved coral reefs in the world. In the mid-afternoon, we’ll continue to Trinidad, a UNESCO World Heritage-listed town that appears much like it did when it was established by Spanish colonists. After checking into our accommodation, we’ll connect with a local photographer, Julio Munoz, whose images of Trinidad have received acclaim. In the comfort of his 19th-century home, you’ll be able to ask any questions you may have of this professional artist and learn about his foundation, Project Diana, which educates Cubans in the proper care of horses. You’ll then have time to wander through the cobblestone streets of Trinidad and capture some images for yourself. Not to miss is the 19th-century Iglesia Parroquial de la Santisima with its expressive wooden altars. We’ll reconvene in the evening for an authentic Cuban meal before an optional night of dancing under the stars at the Casa de la Musica. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch, dinner

Trinidad - Rise early to take advantage of the atmospheric morning light and photograph Trinidad as it slowly comes to life. Join the local children on their walk to school and the farmers heading into the fields, with their consent, of course. We’ll then visit a pottery workshop where you can photograph the ceramicists and discover how this artisan craft is valued in Cuban society. In the late morning, we will travel into the surrounding countryside, which is dotted with sugar cane plantations. After exploring a picturesque river and cascading falls, we’ll relax over a picnic lunch. It’s then time to return to Trinidad for another photography session in the late afternoon light before dinner at a local paladar. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch, dinner

Trinidad & Cienfuegos - You may opt to rise early for another morning photography session in Trinidad before we travel west to the Jardin Botanico Cienfuegos. Initially established by the American sugar baron, Edward F. Atkins, it is one of Cuba’s largest gardens and home to more than 2,000 different plant species. Led by the garden’s staff, you’ll enjoy a guided walk to learn about the site’s history and its seedling heritage. Afterward, we’ll continue to the waterfront city of Cienfuegos, which has been nicknamed the “Pearl of the South”. It exudes a distinctly French atmosphere due to its colonial history and is now designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. On our photographic tour of the city, we’ll visit Parque Jose Marti and the Palacio del Ayuntamiento, as well as the Teatro Tomas Terry and the impressive Cienfuegos Cathedral. Our walk takes us to the lively Malecon where locals like to congregate and to Punta Gorda with its plantation-era mansions. Our photography tour of Cienfuegos ends at the Moorish and Venetian-inspired Palacio de Valle. Along the way, we’ll stop to chat with cuentapropistas (self-employed workers) to learn about the rapidly growing private economy sector in Cuba. We may also be treated to a performance by the a cappella group, Coro del Cienfuegos, or have the opportunity to visit the distinguished Benny Moré Art School. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch, dinner

Havana - Today, we will return to Havana, with a stop at the Museo de Ernesto Hemingway en route. It occupies the home at Finca Vigia where he lived with his wife and penned nine of his novels. See his daily weigh-in marks and his Royal typewriter, as well as the pool where Ava Gardner once swam. We’ll also visit the seaside village of Cojimar where Hemingway’s beloved boat, “Pilar” was moored. For lunch, we’ll dine at a paladar with its own organic garden and you’ll have the opportunity to learn the art of making a mojito. From here, we’ll continue to the Mercado San Jose, which occupies a historic warehouse overlooking the harbor. It’s a great place to pick up handcrafted goods and souvenirs before heading home. There may also be time to wander through Havana Vieja on your own. For our final night in Cuba, we’ll be picked up from our casa particular in classic cars, and enjoy an unforgettable ride through the Plaza de la Revolucion. Here, you can capture iconic images of Che Guevara and Camilo Cienfuegos before our final meal together at one of the city’s finest paladars. Accommodations: Casas particulares Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch, dinner

Departure - After breakfast, it’s time to say goodbye to Havana as you make your way to the airport for your return flight home. If you have any Cuban currency left, be sure to exchange it before you leave! Meals Included: Breakfast

tourName: Cuba short break, Havana and Vinales
generalInfo:
This tour is perfect for travelers with limited time in Cuba who want to explore beyond the typical tourist attractions. Instead of visiting museums, this tour offers immersive experiences that showcase Cuba's diverse culture, from city living to rural life. Learn about Havana's history, current state, and future direction. By participating in daily cultural activities, supporting community projects, and supporting small businesses, this tour provides a hassle-free way for US travellers to meet the requirements of the 'Support for the Cuban People' general license, ensuring a stress-free and enjoyable trip.

Duration: 5 days / 4 nights (4 days of activities)

Maximum Group Size: 8

Included:
- 4 nights of accomodation in Premium casa particulares
- Private air conditioned transport - minibus or taxi, jeep, open-sided truck
- All breakfasts, 4 lunches, 4 dinners
- Activities noted in itinerary
- Support documentation for US travelers
- Local guide throughout
- Airport arrival transfer

dayInfo.description: Havana. Start time by 9:30a.m. Due to the early start time, we encourage you to arrive the night before. At 9:30 am you’ll meet your tour leader and group members for a warm welcome before we dive into a historic tour of Old Havana, a must-see UNESCO World Heritage site. Explore the four main plazas on a 2-hour walking tour, followed by a delicious lunch at a paladar, a Cubanism for privately owned restaurant. After lunch, we will explore the less touristy neighbourhoods of Old Havana on the Off Beat Havana Tour, where you'll get to experience the local community and learn about the ration system at a neighbourhood bodega. End the evening with a cocktail lesson and dinner at a classic paladar. Included Activities:Historic tour of Old Havana, Offbeat Old Havana tour walk, Cocktail lesson Included Meals: Lunch, Dinner Included accommodations: Vieja Habana or similar

Havana We'll visit a local community project promoting wellness and empowerment, followed by a panoramic city tour in vintage convertible cars where you’ll visit the Havana forest and learn about its deep spiritual significance. Enjoy a traditional Afro-Cuban lunch before diving into the fascinating history of the American Mafia and its role in pre-revolutionary Cuba. Tonight’s dinner is at a river-view restaurant, founded by an internationally recognised local sailing enthusiast where we will dine on fresh seafood in a unique atmosphere. This evening we visit the famous Fabrica de Arte Cubano. Named one of Time Magazine’s World’s 100 Greatest Places, you’ll see why as we tour the oil factory turned arts complex. Featuring five salons showcasing various types of art, from textiles, to architecture, music, dance, and eye-catching installations, plus bars and pop-up shops, you’ll marvel at the innovation and talent of ‘New Cuba’. Included Activities: Meeting with local community members, Afro-Cuban show, classic car tour, Mafia history tour, and Fabrica de Arte Cubano Included Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

HavanaToday we’ll learn about how individuals used their talents to fuel positive change in their neighborhoods on this special tour to three remarkable neighborhoods in Havana, including one which caught the notice of President Obama on his 2016 visit to Cuba. After lunch we cover the topic of ‘cuentapropistas’ entrepreneurship in Cuba. In 2011 the Cuban Government began opening the private sector and legalising private businesses not seen since the 1959 Revolution. We will illustrate this topic with a visit to two of Havana’s successful new businesses to hear their stories. Included Activities: ‘Murals and Mosaics’ local art communities tour with lunch, meet & greet at two local businesses. Included Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Vinales. The Viñales add-on. We have a full day of breathtaking natural beauty and rural charm in store. Depart by 8am in the morning for a 3-hour journey west towards the mountains and the province of Pinar del Rio. On our way into the town of Vinales we will stop at the Cuevas del Indio (Indian Caves) for a boat ride. You will also see the controversial Prehistoric Mural (is it art or eyesore?). Arriving in the town of Viñales, we will explore tobacco fields, roll cigars, and taste local coffee with our local guide. After our light trek through the valley, we will enjoy a farm-to-fork lunch at an organic farm before returning to Havana for our final night and farewell meal. Included Activities: Day trip to Viñales - visit to tobacco farm, organic farm, Indian caves and Prehistoric Mural. Included Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner.
Depart at any time today, there are no activities scheduled.

placesVisited: Old Havana, Vinales Valley tobacco plantations, Bay of Pigs picnic, Cienfuegos, Trinidad salsa lesson, Che Guevara mausoleum in Santa Clara
generalInfo:
See the very best of central Cuba on this small group holiday. It begins and ends in Havana, the hectic, complicated capital city. Old Havana piles up sun-bleached monuments, Cuban tapas bars, Spanish cathedrals and sky-high murals. Or you could cycle along the Malecon to see Miramar and the shining suburbs out west.

You'll spend the rest of the week hopping between some of the prettiest places in Cuba, while experiencing life away from the big city. See how Cuban cigars are made in the Vinales Valley, where sloping tobacco plantations and limestone karsts paint the hills. Share dinner with a Cuban family in Cienfuegos. And road trip down to Trinidad, where there's a musician on every corner.

Opting for a small group holiday to Cuba gets you closer to the people that live there, so perks include relaxed salsa lessons and homestay accommodation (casas particulares) that give you real insight into a revolutionary country.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Havana, the lively capital of Cuba. Founded by the Spanish in the 16th century, it is now a soulful mix of colonial architecture, street troubadours and classic cars. We check into our first casas particulares of the trip; today is all about settling in and unwinding after your flight. Meet your tour leader and fellow passengers today at the start accommodation. Accommodation: Casas particulares

Today, we travel to the Viñales Valley in the west of Cuba. Famous for its rolling tobacco plantations and collection of limestone karsts, it’s easy to see why Viñales was awarded World Heritage status. Joined by a local resident, we walk through the Valley of Silence to soak up rural Cuban life as farmers tend to their crops using traditional farming methods. We also visit a tobacco farm to learn about the famous Cuban export and meet with a tobacco farmer to understand the growing process. After checking into our casas particulares, we visit a farm in the Viñales hills for a sunset dinner overlooking the valley. Accommodation: Casas particulares

This morning, we have a long drive eastward to Playa Larga. We stop at a farmer’s house in the village of Palpite with the aim of seeing the smallest birds in the world, the bee hummingbird, who like to feed on the farmer’s patio. We are then joined by a local nature expert who introduces us to the natural landscape and characteristics of the area. We also visit a small community arts and dance school in Palpite to meet participants and learn about the importance of the arts in Cuba. If time, we can also enjoy a refreshing swim in the turquoise waters of the Bay of Pigs. Tonight, we enjoy a traditional creole dinner followed by the quintessentially Cuban pastime of dominoes and rum. Today’s travel time is approximately five hours. Accommodation: Casas particulares

This morning, we continue eastwards to Cienfuegos, known as the Pearl of the South. Cienfuegos is a city full of architectural delights and Cuban spirit with a beautiful main square and restored buildings. On arrival, we tour the city by e-tricycle, fun tuk tuk-like vehicles that can accommodate four people and run on solar power. Used locally as public transport, they provide an authentic way to see the city. After, we depart Cienfuegos and drive down the coast to Trinidad, a World Heritage site since 1988 and perhaps the best-preserved colonial town on the island. Exploring Trinidad is like stepping back in time, the cobbled streets and horse-drawn transportation whisking you back to the Colonial era. There are many interesting museums in old colonial buildings and music drifts through the streets and plazas, bringing the town to life. We have a walking tour to learn what it’s like to live in Trinidad, which includes a visit to Casa Templo de Santeria de Yemaya where we learn about Santeria, an Afro-Cuban religion. This evening, we meet a local barman at a private paladar who is an expert at mixing the perfect mojito! We learn how to mix mojitos in the authentic Cuban way then enjoy dinner at the paladar before returning to our casas particulares. Accommodation: Casas particulares

This morning, we transfer to Playa Ancón, making a short stop to visit the picturesque fishing village of La Boca. This is a popular spot with local fishermen, who we meet and speak to about the fishing industry in Cuba. Then we carry on to Playa Ancón and enjoy time at the beach. It is a great place to swim or you can simply dip your toes in the water and relax. After, we have an authentic Cuban lunch prepared for us. On our return to Trinidad in the afternoon, there is the option to take part in a salsa class, learning the fundamentals with Cuban dance partners. Trinidad is known for its nightlife, so after we’ve learnt the salsa basics, we visit Casa de la Trova, a legendary live music venue, to listen to local musicians playing authentic Cuban music. This venue is always lively and sociable, with plenty of Cubans keen to let us improve our moves with them! Accommodation: Casas particulares

Leave Trinidad after breakfast and head to Manaca Iznaga, where we visit a project that showcases the skilled process of making textile handicrafts. Manaca Iznaga and the surrounding Valle de los Ingenios was a hugely important sugar-growing area in the 18th and 19th centuries and we learn about that history here. As we have a long transfer today, we take packed lunches from our accommodation. We also visit a country farm where you can enjoy a cafecito (Cuban coffee) and learn about the crops grown in the area. As well as being welcomed into their house for a cafecito, we have a short walk around the property with the owners, learning about small-scale agriculture techniques and industry in rural Cuba. Our next stop is Santa Clara, the site of the last battle of the Cuban Revolution in December 1958, just before Fidel Castro took Havana. Che Guevara and his troops ambushed an armoured train carrying arms to Santiago de Cuba and this was a major turning point in the Revolution. We visit the Mausoleum of Che Guevara and his comrades who died in Bolivia before driving back to Havana. Today’s travel time is approximately five to six hours. Accommodation: Casas particulares

This morning, we have a walking tour of Havana, the capital and largest city in Cuba. We walk the streets of Old Havana, often described as a living museum with magnificent monuments, cathedrals and palaces, as well as seeing the famous Capitolio building and four of the city’s principal squares. During our tour, we also visit a ration store, food market and artisan market. There is no better way to see Havana than by classic car. This afternoon, we get acquainted with both the old and new areas of the city in pristine classic cars, discovering the distinct areas of the capital and stopping at points of interest for explanations and stories. Stops include the historic Plaza de la Revolución and bustling Vedado district. Our final dinner is at a private paladar, run by an entrepreneurial chef who pioneers a fusion of Cuban and Asian cuisine. Accommodation: Casas particulares
This morning is free to relax or do some last-minute sightseeing in Havana Old Town before we bid a fond farewell to each other and begin our return journeys home.

placesVisited: Havana, Soroa, Vinales, Bay of Pigs, Cienfuegos, Trinidad, Santa Clara, informal salsa lesson included
generalInfo:
This week long Cuba group tour lets you discover the history and heritage of this stunning Caribbean island alongside the natural attraction and the cultural splendour that make Cuba group tours the hottest tickets on the planet right now.

From the American invasion to political posturing, this is your chance to go on a Cuba group tour and see the traditional sights and experience the Latin American rhythm and flair before things change beyond all recognition.

Hats off to Havana, soak up the mountain air around Soroa and the sunshine of Playa Ancon before heading to Trinidad for some laid back vibes to stop you in your tracks. Cuba group tours will take you all over the island with a back story of classic cars, fat cigars and a whole lot of hot and spicy salsa in between – so what are you waiting for?

dayInfo.title: Havana.
dayInfo.description: Bienvenidos! Welcome to Cuba. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm tonight in Havana. If you arrive early, the day is yours to explore. Consider a stroll through Old Havana to acquaint yourself with its colourful mix of 50s Americana, colonial architecture and budding modernity. There are plenty of good museums to check out, such as the Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes (National Museum of Fine Arts). Perhaps line up with the locals for a taste of the legendary Coppelia ice cream, or wander along the Malecon, the sea wall that skirts the coastline.

dayInfo.title: Soroa / Vinales.
dayInfo.description: Spend the morning enjoying a short tour around Old Havana with your local guide. Founded in 1519 by the Spanish and designated a World Heritage Site in 1982, this well-preserved area within Cuba’s capital remains virtually unchanged which makes it one of the Caribbean’s most impressive historical cities. Wander through Havana’s oldest square, Plaza de Armas, stroll around the architecturally eclectic buildings that line the 16th century Plaza Veija, admire the basilica of San Francisco de Asis and visit the Cathedral with its elaborate baroque facade. After, drive to Soroa, a lush enclave nestled in a picturesque valley and aptly known as the ‘rainbow of Cuba’. Stop for lunch and tour a beautiful orchid garden where you’ll learn the medicinal secrets behind wild Cuban herbs, before continuing your journey to Vinales. Located in the province of Pinar del Rio – Vinales is a landscape of tobacco and agricultural fields dotted with limestone outcrops. The scenery here is some of the most picturesque in Cuba and there are many ways to take it all in, ask your leader about the optional activities available including cycling, walking through tobacco fields and hiking to the mountains to explore the vast cave system of Gran Caverna de Santo Tomas.

dayInfo.title: Vinales.
dayInfo.description: This morning, enjoy a walking tour through farms, tobacco plantations and lush cultivated lands for an insight into rural life in Vinales. Learn more about the simple lifestyle here and see first-hand the farmers who grow tobacco for some of the world’s most expensive cigars. For dinner this evening, relish a real garden-to-plate experience with an included dinner at an organic eco-farm. Indulge in a variety of fresh produce – from numerous vegetables and salads to meats, seafood and salsas – all while gazing across sweeping views of the verdant valley. After, why not head out to a quaint bar and get to know some of Vinales’ residents. This small and charming rural village is one of the easiest places to mingle with locals in Cuba, who are very sociable, and many of them love nothing better than to drink rum and dance the night away!

dayInfo.title: Bay of Pigs / Cienfuegos.
dayInfo.description: Begin the day by travelling to a peaceful sandy arc on Cuba’s southern coast, commonly known as the Bay of Pigs. Learn about the Bay of Pigs Invasion – the battle between the US and the Cuban revolutionaries which resulted in the first defeat of a US-backed takeover in Latin America. Then, stop for a dip in its tranquil waters, with an outstanding variety of coral and fish, it just might be Cuba’s best-kept secret. Then continue along the picturesque coast to Cienfuegos, a slice of Paris in the Caribbean. This is the gem of the south, a seaside town of relaxing streets and dazzling buildings that strike a beautiful pose by the water. Founded in 1819 by pioneering French immigrants, the elegant architectural influence that these settlers brought with them earned the city a UNESCO World Heritage Site listing in 2005. Enjoy a photo stop at Palacio del Valle, which is Cienfuegos' architectural pride and joy. Learn more about its history as you take in the beauty of its intricate carvings of Venetian alabaster and if you’re up for it, why not head to the rooftop for a sunset drink.

dayInfo.title: Trinidad.
dayInfo.description: Perhaps kick-start your morning with some Cuban coffee (it's served black, strong and super sweet) then bid farewell to Cienfuegos and board the bus for a short drive to Trinidad – a beautifully preserved colonial down that sits on the scenic Caribbean coast. There's no doubt it's one of Cuba's alluring destinations, a great place to wander around, with almost every scene offering a photo opportunity. Watch as locals casually smoke their huge cigars on the doorsteps of their homes, and hear the old Chevrolets rumbling by. Begin by strolling along the cobbled streets and marvelling at some of the colourful colonial architecture on display (this town was put on the UNESCO World Heritage list in 1988 for good reason), then feel the Cuban rhythms during a casual salsa class – a sure-fire way to boost your confidence in preparation for Trinidad’s nightlife!

dayInfo.title: Trinidad.
dayInfo.description: Trinidad’s old-fashioned feel and friendly folk make it a standout destination for many visitors to Cuba, and the Santeria religion (a voodoo-like Afro-Cuban tradition) which is practiced here makes the town even more intriguing. Enjoy a free day to check-out Trinidad at your own pace. There are some great Spanish-style churches to see, and nearby is the Valle de los Ingenios, where sugar plantations stretch out as far as the eye can see. Why not go for a dip at nearby Playa Ancon and loll about on the long stretches of white sand or hire a bike of the vintage variety and cycle along Trinidad’s colourful (and cobblestone) streets. If you’re feeling energetic, then hiking in the Sierra del Escambray (the local mountains) is a great option – just ask your leader to help you decide! This evening, a folklore dance and music show in one of the open-air venues is highly recommended – a great chance to immerse yourself in Cuba's African, French and Spanish-influenced music and dance culture.

dayInfo.title: Santa Clara / Havana.
dayInfo.description: On your way back to Havana, you'll stop in at Santa Clara to visit the Che Guevara mausoleum and memorial where you can get a rare insight into the legacy of the revolutionary leader. Che's remains were brought to rest here after they were found in a remote corner of Bolivia in 1997, where he was assassinated by the CIA-backed Bolivian army. The memorial is home to an impressive bronze statue of Che bearing his rifle and inside the museum, you can learn about his amazing life and see photos and exhibits such as letters, firearms, medical devices and other interesting artefacts – including his famous black beret. Upon arrival in Havana, stop by Revolution square then prepare for a final night of celebrations where you can toast to an incredible adventure across beautiful Cuba!

dayInfo.title: Havana.
dayInfo.description: Your trip comes to an end this morning after breakfast, check-out time is 10 am. If you wish to stay on in this colourful capital, just speak to your booking agent.

generalInfo:
*This trip meets all the standards as required by the US OFAC category "Support for the Cuban People".

Cuba travel, legal and local… Thanks to the small group size, we avoid the big, government-run establishments, most of which US travelers aren’t allowed to patronize. As a small group, we can also dine at privately owned restaurants to support everyday citizens. Our groups of 12 travelers or less can visit smaller, more off-the-beaten-path places for more meaningful interaction with locals. Below are some of the things that make our small group trips to Cuba unique:

Authentic, local interaction: Your own dedicated Cuban trip leader throughout the trip will be your friend and show you Cuba through the eyes of a local.

Playa Larga: A sleepy beach town on the Bay of Pigs to escape the hordes of travelers at the major tourist hotspots. It’s a great place to witness everyday Cuban life in a typical Cuban town.

FAC: The Fábrica de Arte Cubano is a great place to mingle with Cubans over a drink while listening to live music and admiring works of art by local artists.

INCLUDED:
- 8 nights accommodation in casa particulares (double occupancy)
- Cuban trip leader throughout
- Private, air-conditioned transportation
- Activities as noted in itinerary
- All breakfasts, 6 lunches, 4 dinners

dayInfo.description: HAVANA ARRIVAL - Welcome to Cuba! Arrive in Havana and settle into your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time, you will have some free time to walk around Havana. In the evening, meet for dinner as a group at a local paladar, a privately-owned restaurant and a great example of Cuba’s shift to a more free-market economy. Why not enjoy your first Cuban mojito tonight or even a flight of Cuban rum to kick off the great adventure that lies ahead? *Airport pick-up is not included. You can easily take a taxi from the airport to your accommodation in the city. *INCLUDED - Activities: Arrival (at your own expense); Free time; Welcome dinner • Meals: D • Accommodation: Casa particular.

HAVANA - Hop in a classic convertible car and go for a drive stopping first at a monument that many visitors don’t get to see: El Cristo de la Bahia. Then, on to the neighborhoods of Vedado and Miramar with a stop at the historic Plaza de la Revolucion where Fidel used to address the masses. The last stop will be along the Malecon where the ocean waves hit the sea wall and many Cubans like to hang out to beat the heat. After the drive, go for a guided walk of Old Havana, one of the best-preserved colonial cities in the Americas. The streets are lined with colonial architecture, 16th-century fortresses, and numerous churches. There is so much to see here and your trip leader has some secret spots he will show you along the way. After the waking tour, go for lunch at a local paladar after which you will have the rest of the afternoon at your leisure. Later that night, make your way to the trendy and unique gallery/bar/performance space, Fabrica de Arte Cubano, for a drink and to check out some of the local art on display. This former cooking oil factory has been renovated into a hip gallery with multiple spaces showcasing works by local Cuban artists. For those who would like to keep the party going, you can stay later when it opens up to a bar and club! *INCLUDED - Activities: Classic car tour; Old Havana walking tour; Free time; Fabrica de Arte Cubano • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Casa particular.

HAVANA - VIÑALES - This morning, you will be on your way to Viñales, one of the most picturesque parts of Cuba. It is a small, culturally rich town with friendly residents. This area is also said to be where the best tobacco in the world grows! Before leaving Havana, stop at Fusterlandia, a unique work of public art composed of over 80 houses decorated with ornate murals and domes to suit the personality of each of Fuster’s neighbors. After checking out the neighborhood, onward to Viñales! Once you’ve arrived in Viñales, get settled into your accommodation and have a bit of free time. Later, there will be a quick orientation walk around this small town where farmers have been producing cigars the same way for generations. Your trip leader will point out some dinner options along the way. In the evening, go out for drinks at Centro Cultural Polo Montañez, a popular hangout spot with salsa music where you can practice your salsa moves and party a lo Cubano! *INCLUDED - Transfers: Havana - Viñales by minibus (approx. 3 hrs) • Activities: Fusterlandia; Viñales orientation walk; Free time; Centro Cultural Polo Montanez • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Casa particular.

VIÑALES - Start your day with a truly organic breakfast. Nearly everything is produced in the area and breakfast usually includes local fruits, freshly squeezed juice, coffee, milk, and eggs. In the morning, visit a local tobacco farm and drying house where you’ll learn about the tradition of Cuban cigars from a farmer and expert cigar maker. Get insight into how agriculture works under the communist system; how much tobacco they keep, give back to the government, and how they make ends meet. Discover the entire process from tobacco planting to rolling the final cigar all while sipping some freshly roasted Cuban coffee. Of course, after the final product is rolled, you can try a Cuban cigar! Lunch is not included today but your trip leader can give you some recommendations. Don’t fill up too much because tonight’s dinner will be quite a feast! After lunchtime, perfect your moves at a salsa lesson. Beginners will learn the basic steps while more advanced salseros can learn the intricacies of Cuban salsa. Later this evening, head to a local farmer’s organic farm and learn about sustainable farming in Cuba without pesticides. With a beautiful sunset as a backdrop along with a clear view of the hills and valleys, you’ll enjoy a delicious meal prepared by the family – a truly authentic farm-to-fork experience! *INCLUDED - Activities: Local tobacco farm; Salsa lesson; Organic farm visit & dinner • Meals: B, D • Accommodation: Casa particular.

VIÑALES - PLAYA LARGA - Today, depart toward the famous (or should we say infamous?) Bay of Pigs! During the drive, you will learn a bit about Cuban life, history, society, culture, and of course, the Bay of Pigs invasion from your trip leader. There will be a quick stop for lunch right before arrival to Playa Larga, a town at the top of the Bay of Pigs, where you’ll spend the night. Upon arrival, you’ll have free time to stretch your legs on the beach or go for a refreshing swim. There’ll be a hands-on happy hour before dinner during which you’ll learn how to make mojitos. After trying your homemade mojitos, come together for a large meal prepared by a local family as you watch the sunset over the Bay of Pigs! *INCLUDED - Transfers: Viñales - Bay of Pigs by minibus (approx. 5 hrs) • Activities: Free time; Mojito making lesson • Meals: B, L, D • Accommodation: Casa particular.

LARGA PLAYA - TRINIDAD - After breakfast, hit the road to the colorful city of Trinidad! Settle into your accommodation and then, head out together to check out the city, home to numerous churches and beautiful colonial buildings. This region was most famous for its commercial production of sugar. You can see many grand houses that were once owned by kings of the sugar industry and learn about the history of the area. Your accommodation is situated in the heart of the city so it’s perfect for exploring and you have the rest of the afternoon and evening to do so. There are many shops and galleries in Trinidad and it is very pedestrian-friendly so you can easily take a stroll around the city. For those of you who are night owls, we suggest a night out on the town. If you missed out in Viñales, make sure to venture out so you can get a taste of local nightlife! Your trip leader knows the best spots in town and he will recommend places where the locals go for a fun-filled night with live music and dancing! *INCLUDED - Transfers: Bay of Pigs - Trinidad by minibus (approx. 3 hrs) • Activities: Trinidad orientation walk; Free time • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Casa particular.

TRINIDAD - This morning, learn about the history of the area, the local industry, and biodiversity during a short hike to Salto de Javira waterfall just outside of the city. The easy to moderate* hike is about one hour each way and is a scenic trek through the jungle. After cooling off and taking a dip in the natural pools at the base of the waterfall, return to Trinidad where you’ll have the rest of the afternoon to relax and explore on your own. In the afternoon, you’ll have free time to explore the city or hit Playa Ancon for swimming on the beautiful white sand beach. Later in the evening, we suggest a local spot for live music and dancing. *Depending on your fitness level, you may find this hike more difficult. If you do not think you can do it or do not want to, please let your trip leader know. *INCLUDED - Activities: Salto de Javira waterfall hike; Playa Ancon; Free time • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Casa particular.

TRINIDAD - HAVANA - Return to Havana today with a quick stop for lunch along the way. You will have some free time to freshen up and get in some last-minute souvenir shopping before heading to your last dinner together in Havana. Afterward, we recommend enjoying a final night out with music and dancing! *INCLUDED - Transfers: Trinidad - Havana by minibus (approx. 5 hrs) • Activities: Free time; Farewell dinner • Meals: B, L, D • Accommodation: Casa particular.

HAVANA DEPARTURE - Depending on your flight time, you will have free time on your own in Havana before catching your flight back home. *INCLUDED - Activities: Free time; Departure (at your own expense) • Meals: B. **Itinerary is subject to change.

tourName: Cuba tour, small group with added comfort
generalInfo: This Premium adventure through Cuba plays out to the soundtrack of a sizzling salsa beat, against a vibrant backdrop of colonial architecture, sweeping beaches and verdant countryside. Cuba’s colourful history still dominates most aspects of daily life, painting the country with an atmosphere like no other. Explore Havana in all its faded glory, uncover the easy beauty of rural Vinales, wander the cobblestoned streets of Trinidad and soak up the coastal vibe of Cienfuegos. Let Cuba’s charm wash over you on an unforgettable journey.

dayInfo.title: Havana.
dayInfo.description: Bienvenidos! Welcome to Cuba. Your Premium adventure begins in Havana, the country’s capital. You’ll be met at the airport by a local representative and transferred to your Feature Stay hotel for a welcome meeting at 6 pm. If you arrive early, there are plenty of excellent museums to check out, including the Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes. After your meeting, head to a local restaurant for dinner. Tonight, your leader will introduce you to some classic dishes such as picadillo (a beef and tomato stew) and ropa vieja (pulled beef with vegetables).

dayInfo.title: Havana.
dayInfo.description: Start the day in style as you tour the city in a convoy of classic American vintage cars. Cruise down Havana’s grand old streets as your leader points out significant sights like the Malecon, Revolucion Square and Vedado. Finish your ride in Old Havana where you’ll continue your explorations on foot during a walking tour with your leader. Learn the history of the Havana cathedral and discover the city’s old-world charm when you stop by Plaza de Armas, San Francisco de Asis, Plaza Vieja and Central Park. You then have a free afternoon – maybe head to a rooftop bar for a cocktail or stroll around the colourful streets.

dayInfo.title: Vinales.
dayInfo.description: Before departing Havana, visit Deshidratados Havana – a local dehydrated fruit workshop founded during the pandemic to help with food scarcity. Learn about how the natural preserves are made without any sugar or preservatives, and try out some samples. Next, drive west to Soroa, where you’ll tour a beautiful orchid garden. Meet with a local guide for a private tour of the gardens and learn about the vibrant array of plant and bird species – it’s not hard to see why this valley is known as the rainbow of Cuba. Make a stop at the Castle in the Clouds, a mountain-top property with wonderful views, take some time out for lunch and then continue to Vinales, where tobacco and sugarcane fields lie side by side and limestone outcrops dot the landscape. Use this travel time to take part in an informal Spanish lesson so you can converse with the friendly locals throughout the rest of your trip. Check in to your guesthouses, then take a short orientation walk with your leader to get acquainted with the town.

dayInfo.title: Vinales.
dayInfo.description: Begin your day with a guided walk through the farmlands of Vinales, where your leader will talk to you about the geography that makes up the area’s spectacular scenery. Vinales is known for its tobacco farms which still use traditional growing methods – learn more about the longstanding tobacco industry and watch a farmer whip up a world class cigar in seconds. Take some time to find a local place for lunch, then regroup in the late afternoon for a salsa dancing lesson. Find your feet and learn a few steps while embracing the electrifying rhythm of Cuba. After working up an appetite, head to the top of the valley for dinner at an eco-farm. Here you’ll enjoy an exceptional farm-to-table meal made entirely from organic produce grown on site.

dayInfo.title: Cienfuegos.
dayInfo.description: Prepare for a long travel day as you make your way to Cienfuegos. Drive back through Havana before stopping in the Bay of Pigs for lunch. After lunch, you may like to take a dip in the crystal clear water, or unroll your beach towel and sit back as your leader shares stories of the botched USA Military counter-revolutionary invasion in the Bay of Pigs. Now a tranquil spot for relaxing, it’s hard to imagine the chaotic battle that took place here in 1961. Then it’s just a short drive to Cienfuegos, one of Cuba's prettiest coastal spots. Arrive in the early evening and join your leader on a short orientation walk before visiting the Palacio del Valle – Cienfuegos' architectural pride and joy.

dayInfo.title: Trinidad.
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a free morning in Cienfuegos – maybe stop by a local cafe for a cup of Cuban coffee. Then make the journey to Trinidad. When you arrive, your leader will introduce you to the town’s history and architecture during a walking tour. Take in Trinidad’s eye-catching combination of cobblestone streets, colourful houses and old-fashioned locals. It's a great town to explore on foot, and almost every scene offers great photo opportunities – from residents relaxing with huge cigars on their doorsteps to old Chevrolets cruising by. In the evening take a trip out of town to a local house for a homely and festive dinner. Be welcomed with the local drink, Canchanchara, made from 'fire water' (local honey and lime juice). There will even be a musician or two serenading you and your fellow travellers as you dine.

dayInfo.title: Trinidad.
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to explore all that Trinidad has to offer. For some beachside fun and maybe a little snorkelling, head down to Playa Ancon (just be careful you don't stand on a sea urchin!). The town is dotted with open-air venues where you can check out a folklore show that nods to Cuba’s rich and varied music and dance tradition. With roots in Spain, Africa and France the show displays Cuba’s history.

dayInfo.title: Havana.
dayInfo.description: Head inland with a stop at the Valle De Los Ingenios Scenic Viewpoint, where you'll have a drink while soaking in the views of sugar cane plantations. Continue to the beautiful city of Santa Clara, where you’ll enjoy an included lunch followed by a visit to the Che Guevara mausoleum. Here, you’ll see the imposing statue of the iconic revolutionary leader. In the museum that accompanies the mausoleum, you'll find a spread of photos and other ephemera related to Che – letters, medical devices and firearms. Return to Havana and arrive at your hotel, one of the newest in Havana. Perhaps soak in the amazing views from the rooftop pool or indulge in a mojito at the bar.

dayInfo.title: Havana .
dayInfo.description: Your Cuban adventure comes to an end after breakfast this morning. As there's a great deal to do in Havana, it’s recommended that you stay a few extra days to make the most of this exciting city. If you need help booking extra accommodation, just get in touch with your booking agent.

placesVisited: Havana, Walking tour of Old Havana, Museum of the Revolution, Santa Clara, Che Museum, Camaguey, Bayamo, Turquino National Park, hike to La Comandancia de la Plata, Santo Domingo, Santiago de Cuba, Fidels final resting place, El Morro castle
generalInfo:
Follow in the footsteps of Fidel and Che on this fascinating 10 day holiday, travelling along Cuba’s Revolutionary Trail. It was over 50 years ago that Fidel Castro and his followers drove into Havana and pronounced the revolution successful, declaring that a new era in the history of Cuba was about to begin. This trip travels the length of this beautiful island to give a thorough insight into the history of the Cuban Revolution.

The adventure starts in the historic city of Santiago de Cuba, the ‘cradle of the revolution’ where Castro and his supporters gained huge popular backing and plotted to overthrow the Batista regime. The trip then travels up into the Sierra Maestra mountains via Bayamo to visit La Comandancia, the secret base where Castro planned and commanded revolutionary activities, before taking in Camaguey, Playa Giron (Bay of Pigs) and Santa Clara, visiting the most interesting historical sites along the way. From here, we head for the capital city of Havana where our journey ends.

In the Sierra Maestra mountains there is some easy hiking, and throughout this holiday there are visits to historical and culturally important sites around the island, with lots of opportunity to meet local communities. You will also have the chance to hear fabulous live Cuban music on accompanied nights out.

This is a tailor made trip for two or more people, available all year round. The itinerary can be altered to suit personal requirements and is an over 50s friendly tour. Transport is by national bus service with some private transfers where required. Accommodation is in homestays or hotels. You will be met in each location by a specialist local guide, making this a wonderful chance to find out about the Cuban Revolution in detail, experiencing the magic of Cuba and its people at grass roots level. We can also arrange for you to be accompanied by a specialist local tour guide from start to finish if you prefer.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Santiago de Cuba. Depending on time of arrival, you could have a short orientation walk of the city centre with a local guide. Homestay accommodation in Santiago de Cuba including breakfast and dinner x 3 nights. Dinner at homestay and evening free.

Breakfast at accommodation. Morning guided city tour of Santiago including visit to the Santa Ifigenia cemetery where Fidel Castro is buried and the Jose Marti mausoleum can be found; San Juan Hill and other historic sites in the city, and the Alameda seafront promenade. Visit to a local community project/dance company rehearsal. Free time for lunch (not included) and then continue to La Granjita farmhouse, where Fidel and his men stayed the night before the fateful assault on Moncada Barracks. Return to your homestay and rest of day free. Dinner at homestay. Free evening to listen to live music at a local venue.

After breakfast, private transfer to the historic city of Bayamo. Short walking tour and visit to Carlos Manuel Cespedes museum, the first plantation owner in Cuba to release his slaves. Lunch (included) and continue to Santo Domingo at the gateway to the Turquino national park. Check into Hotel Villa Santo Domingo including dinner & breakfast x 2 nights. Dinner and rest of day free.

After early breakfast, depart with guide and private transport from your hotel by jeep to reach the trail head. Full day hiking to La Comandancia (3km each way) with a specialist park guide. Picnic lunch provided. Visit the former secret HQ of Fidel and his men in the heart of the Sierra Maestra mountains and return by the same trail to be picked up for transfer back to your hotel. Dinner and rest of day free.

Private transfer from Santo Domingo to Playa Las Coloradas where Fidel and his men arrived after exile in Mexico. Arrive Camaguey late afternoon. Check-in to homestay accommodation including breakfast x 1 night. Rest of evening free.
After breakfast, private transfer from Camaguey to Santa Clara to arrive late afternoon. Check into guesthouse accommodation, including breakfast x 1 night. Rest of day free.

Visit the Tren Blindado and the Che Guevara museum this morning with an English speaking guide, and free time for lunch (not included). Private transfer after lunch to Playa Giron for a visit to the Bay of Pigs museum and then continue along the coastal road to Playa Larga. Check into local homestay including dinner and breakfast x 1 night. Rest of evening free.

Private transfer from Playa Larga to Havana via the community called Australia where there is a small museum dedicated to the Cuban defence of the Bay of Pigs. On arrival into Havana, check into homestay accommodation, breakfast included, x 2 nights

Half day guided visit on foot of Old Havana with local guide, exploring the 4 main city squares. Lunch in local restaurant and afternoon guided visit to the Museum of the Revolution. Final night dinner at local restaurant.
Breakfast and check out of accommodation. Private transfer to Havana airport.

placesVisited: Havana, Pinar de Rio, Viñales, Soroa, Sierra del Rosario, Trinidad, Bay of Pigs, Sierra Escambray, Playa Ancon, Santa Clara, Che Guevara Mausoleum, Optional: Cayo Levisa, Cayo Jutias, tobacco farm, catamaran excursion to Playa Leguano, snorkelling
generalInfo:
These Cuba tours take you to the Pearl of The Caribbean with the best individual programs available to experience Cuban nature & culture.

Cuba is a beautiful island surrounded by sandy beaches, coral reefs and blue waters. It has a very specific vibration of its own - the Cuban people show a playfulness and a joy which is remarkable. They celebrate life with humour, love and passion.

The nature on Cuba is still very pure, the people a discovery for the heart - Travelling in Cuba is an eye and heart opener, suitable for couples, honeymoons, friends and families alike.

Cuba has the potential to show us something: the dream, how it all started, how it went and what is needed to realize a new way of organizing our global economy. Cuba can have a great future. Most of the people are highly educated and aware of social values. Cuba needs however the space and time to adjust in its own rhythm and to develop its society to the human needs and values of today in all freedom. We are specialists in nature & travelling in Cuba.

Example itinerary - Cuba tours: Roundtrip West Cuba with rental car or as bus travel with some taxi transfers. The accommodation is based on Cuban hotels, all selected for a spectacular view or a specific setting and atmosphere. If you prefer to stay in carefully selected "casas particulares" (private homes of Cuban families) instead of a hotel, or have an interesting mixture of both, we can arrange all your reservations.

In a tailor made itinery we can include all items that may have your interest like: tours with Vintage American cars over Cuba (honeymoon programs usually have this), cultural tours with private guides at all cities, biking daytours and full cycling itineries, daywalks and several day hikes (Vinales, Mil Cumbres, Soroa, Sierra Escambray, Sierra Maestra and in Baracoa we have now more than 8 different programs with biking, walking, horse riding, jeep safari and rafting), private guided birdwatching excursions at Vinales, NP Zapata and Sierra Rosario (Soroa), we have a mountain lodge for endemic birdwatching between Vinales mogotes (18 species of the 26), cenote trail at NP Zapata, catamaran trips to tropical keys, deep sea and salt water lake fishing, diving at Maria La Gorda, Isle of Youth, Bay of Pigs, Trinidad, Jardines de la Reina etc, visiting caves at Vinales. Further we can offer private Cuban cooking classes with chefs in Havana & Trinidad, reservations for gourmet dining at top restaurants, tickets for Buena Vista Social Club, National Theatre & Tropicana show, Spanish courses in Havana and learn Spanish in Cuba’s capital which offers everything from museums to art galleries, salsa clubs, friendly people as well as a natural beauty of beaches around. And last but not least we can arrange private salsa classes in Havana and Trinidad (or drum classes) with professional dancers (also couples). We offer homestays (casas particulares) where you can meet your Spanish teacher, where you can learn the Cuban cuisine and meet your salsa teachers right away who take you to their home or dance studio for learning the casino style. Country homestay in Vinales with trails leading from the backyard into the mogote mountains from top class home at the coast near Trinidad from where you can snorkel directly into the sea to coral gardens. We also offer special LGBT programs in Havana and we can request for LGBT guides. We have extensive Cuba travel networks all over the island.

Besides individual tailor made tours we also offer our expertise and tourguide services to small groups, the itinery may include all elements your group is looking for, cultural excursions, daywalks, sailing, snorkeling & diving etc. You will be accompanied by an expert on Cuban nature & culture who has guided more than 40 trips on Cuba from West to East. Ask for an itinery with quote and have a chat on Skype with your guide ! Look for the 19 day Cuba-holiday-small-group-tours on the site of Responsible Travel. We also offer a 10 day group program on Harley Davidsons through West-Central Cuba with open inscriptions. We have more than 190 independent reviews on Responsible Travel on our destinations in Latin America from Cuba, Bolivia, Brasil, Peru, Colombia to Chile and Argentina.

Most common travel options on Cuba for individual travelers are:
1) selfdrive with rental car,
2) travel by bus Viazul / Transtur with use of local taxis,
3) all transfers by private taxi transfers (for larger travelparties up to 7 persons these are with minivan taxis); it is possible to have a guide traveling with you all the time in this way but this is not necessary as local guides can be arranged waiting for you at all the locations of the excursions, this depends on your preferences; some larger trajects can be done by regular bus if requested to save on costs; further on some trajects we can arrange taxi transfers or day excursions with American Vintage cars,
4a) rent your own car and have a private guide as guide - driver, or 4b) rent your own car, drive yourself but accompanied by a guide. All guides who accompany you on a travel are official licensed guides. When you travel with a guide all costs for meals, drinks and accommodation of the guide are included in the quotation, only tips come extra.
5) the whole itinery or part of your trip travel with a Vintage car and private driver available for 12 hrs per day, note that the drivers only speak Spanish. See more about all travel options as well with motorbike and bicycle on our website.

We also offer Sail Diving programs in Cuba to the Canarreos islands & Cayo Largo on beautiful yachts liveaboard with professional crew departing from Cienfuegos. Programs with diving are 7 days, for guided sailing without diving can be 4-7 days. You can also dive at the most fascinating diving location in the Caribbean, the Gardens of the Queen, or Jardines de la Reina in Spanish. Important is that we can build here a balanced tailor made land program around this diving week and that this combination of both is also available for individual USA divers. Gardens of the Queen is certainly one of the last virgin reefs known by man. Dive and snorkel sites are well protected from the winds and sea currents. Visibility is more than 40 meters.

Shortlist festivals Cuba:
JAN: Anniversary Revolution Celebrations (1 Jan)
MAR: Caribbean Dance Biennial (March - Biennial)
APR: Old Havana: City in Movement, dance performances (April – Annual), International Corhabana Choir Festival, Havana (April – Annual)
MAY: May Day Celebrations (1 May – Annual)
JUN: Trinidad Carnival / Fiestas San Juaneras (23 June), Camaguey Carnaval / San Juan Camagüeyano (24 June)
JUL: Festival del Caribe / Festival of Fire, Santiago de Cuba (3-9 July), Santiago de Cuba Carnival (21-29 July), 26 July Celebrations (26 July – Annual)
AUG: Festival Internacional de Rap (1 Aug – Annual), Havana Carnival (3-10 August)
SEP: Matamoros Son Festival, Santiago (Sep/Oct)
OCT/NOV: Havana Ballet Festival (28 Oct - 6 Nov), Havana Theatre Festival (Oct/Nov – Annual)
DEC: Parrandas de Remedios (19-24 Dec - Annual)

Important update actual situation West and Central Cuba: all tourist services are working perfectly, our homestays outside Havana have their own generator, they will provide the house of electricity for you and the family in case necessary, all travellers who have been recently on Cuba had a great trip. Further due to shortages in petrol for the rental car market we recommend to travel by private taxi (private minivans for families & groups), regular tourist bus or shuttle minibuses as they fall under the umbrella of the Cuban Government and can make use of special storage stations. We all arrange your transfers by private taxi, van or bus. At the actual situation we do not recommend traveling by rental car as the actual situation is very changeable meaning that we can not predict if you can find sufficient petrol at the regular petrol stations. We do offer rental cars though to experienced travellers who speak Spanish at own risk. It is a kind of adventure and depends very much on everyone’s abilities to deal with eventual challenges. Please plan a chat with us when you wish to receive more details. Cuba stays fascinating and an amazing destination. We also offer since recently again holidays and roundtrips in East Cuba with our teams in Havana & Baracoa, all traveling by private taxi. You can fly in and out from the Holguin international airport.

dayInfo.description: You will be met by our agent on arrival on the airport and travel with private taxi to your boutique homestay / hotel in Old Havana. ) Some ambient 4 - 5 star boutique hotels in Old Havana are hotel Raquel, Conde Villanueva, Ambos Mundos, Florida, Sevilla, Iberostar Parque Central & Grand Packard, Manzana Kempinsky. We also offer top boutique homestays / casas particulares and can quote for several options from normal to high level homestays and 4-5 star hotels.

These two days you can use to visit fascinating Old Havana, which has been adopted as Heritage of Mankind: stroll through the streets, go shopping for hand made clothes, visit colonial houses with large patios, the famous places of Ernest Hemmingway, Museum of Revolution, handicraft market and much more. You can also use one day to go to the beach east of Havana, Playas del Este with a hop on and off bus or with a private Vintage cabriolet. A local English speaking guide and/or driver can be arranged for one or two days. Tickets for ballet performances, tickets for the Ballet Festival and Jazz festival, for the Tropicana show, Buena Vista or Havana Queen salsa shows can be all arranged.

By taxi or bus to the spectacular mogote landscape of Viñales. These are calcareous rock formations full of caves & hidden streams. One of the best homestays with view into valley Vinales or stay at your own free eco apartment in the countryside.

You will have one guided day through the valley of Viñales and experience the life of the tobacco farmers, the cultivation of tobacco, and see the “mogotes” , their caves and their peculiar ecosystems from near. You can visit a tobacco warehouse (despalillo) where the leaves are prepared and fermented, visit cave Santo Thomas, rent a bike, or go to the tropical beach of the island Cayo Levisa or Cayo Hutia for a day excursion.

Today to Soroa or directly to Playa Larga. You can visit a tobacco factory in Pinar del Rio, where the tobacco leaves are made into cigars. The province of Pinar del Rio is world famous for the quality of the tobacco. Homestay near the mountains of the Sierra Rosario. Soroa is surrounded by tropical vegetation and as soon as the night falls you hear the cosy sounds of beetles and glass frogs.

You take a botanical walk with a local guide through the bio reservate of Sierra del Rosario. You can watch birds, visit the ruins of an old French coffee plantation, and take a stroll through the orchid garden or take a dive in the waterfall of Soroa at the end of the day.

From Soroa to Trinidad and if you want you can make a detour along the famous Pigs Bay. You can take a dive in the sea and discover all kind of fishes in an enchanting sea cave while the lunch is prepared. At the end of the midday you will arrive in Trinidad, one of the most beautiful colonial villages in Latin America and Unesco World heritage. In the evening you can enjoy your dinner and immerse yourself in the nightlife and salsa feeling of Trinidad. According to your choice you stay in one of the hotels downtown, or with a Cuban family in a casa particular downtown Trinidad. Optional stay overnight at homestay at the beach in Playa Larga and/or at Cienfuegos and have a private guided citytour in Cienfuegos.

Trinidad and its surroundings have great things to offer to complete your holiday.
